name: Allium cepa
Relationship: Antidotes: ARN.; CHAM.; VERAT.Complementary: PHOSPHOR.; THUJA; PULS.Compare: GELS.; EUPH.; Kali-HY.; ACONITE; IPECAC.

Eyes: Eyes suffused and watery; profuse; BLAND lachrymation, better in open air
Respiratory: SENSATION AS IF LARYNX IS SPLIT AND TORN
HACKING COUGH ON INSPIRING COLD AIR
OPPRESSED BREATHING from pressure in middle of chest
Constricted feeling in region of epiglottis
Head: Headache ceases during menses; returns when flow disappears
Thread-like pains in face
Catarrhal headache, mostly in forehead; WORSE IN WARM ROOM towards evening
Urine: Urine red with much pressure and burning in urethra
Increased secretion of urine with coryza
Sensation of weakness in bladder and urethra
Nose: Fluent coryza with headache, cough, and hoarseness
COPIOUS, WATERY AND EXTREMELY ACRID DISCHARGE
Feeling of a lump at root of nose
Sneezing, especially when entering a warm room
Extremities: Bad effects from getting feet wet
Limbs, especially arms, feel sore and tired
Painful affections of fingers about nails

details: A picture of coryza, with ACRID NASAL discharge and laryngeal symptoms, eye secretion BLAND; singers' cold, WORSE IN WARM ROOM and toward evening; better in open air is presented by this remedy. Specially adapted to phlegmatic patients; colds in DAMP COLD WEATHER. Neuralgic pains, LIKE A FINE THREAD, following amputations or injuries to nerves. Traumatic chronic neuritis. Burning in nose, mouth, throat, bladder and skin. Sensation of glowing heat on different parts of the body.
